attributes.action: Ban Bottom Trawling in all of the UK's Marine Protected Areas
attributes.additional_details:
Bottom trawling represents a highly destructive fishing practice in which weighted nets are dragged across the seabed, indiscriminately killing all types of sea life. 

Despite their designation, bottom-trawl fishing persists within the majority of MPAs. Enforcing robust protections is essential to ensure that these areas fulfil their purpose—supporting the recovery of rare, threatened, and ecologically important habitats and species in UK waters.
attributes.background: We call on the Government to ban bottom trawling in all of the UK's Marine Protected Areas (MPAs).

rejection.details:
The following petition calls for a similar action: 

Ban Trawling in All Marine Protected Areas (MPAs) in UK waters
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/727634
